title: Drawing, "Door with an overdoor"
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash
markings:
Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457d)
Watermark: bird above triple mount and "G A" in circle, below "S", above "F" (RB'45)
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description:
Vertical rectangle. Both of the two door foldings have above and below a small rectangular panel and in the center is a large one. The small panels are decorated with a festoon hanging from bowknots, the latter with an oval representation of teh figure fo a standing woman. They are framed outside by a wreath which is connected by a stem with a lion mask above, below the molded frame. The overdoor shows teh picture of teh entrance into a fortress. Wall as usual. On teh reverse is a sketch, pen, of a doorcase with the door.

Verso: sketch of a doorcase with the door

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Door with an overdoor".
Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-1660.
